entry.title: The Theory of Liminal Happiness
entry.summary:
Author: i88

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,527Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 136

Summary: Jason Todd has the worst and best luck of anyone he knows. He got caught stealing Batman's tires, but then he was adopted by Bruce Wayne. Then Robin, but then Joker. Dead. Resurrected. Replaced. Red Hood. Redemption. On and on with his fucking luck until in the most ridiculous of twists he is the only person on earth who can help a young witch regain her powers after her literal demon of an ex-boyfriend stole them. All she needs from Jason is his hair, his blood, and his virginity. At least she doesn't need him to die again.

entry.title: Apartment 3B
entry.summary:
Author: ElaineInABox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,378Chapters: 13/16Kudos: 578

Summary: You weren’t looking for love, just somewhere cheap, quiet, and safe enough to get you through the semester. Jason Todd wasn’t looking for company, just a roommate who wouldn’t ask questions about why he came home at two AM bloody and bruised.But in a cramped apartment in Crime Alley, between burnt coffee, leaky ceilings, and the soft hum of the city that never sleeps, the silence between you starts to change. What begins as survival becomes something quieter, steadier—something that almost feels like home.

entry.title: we're all reaching out to find another hand
entry.summary:
Author: soter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 56,057Chapters: 12/18Kudos: 184

Summary: “I know you’re a meta,” you blurt. Jason stares. “What.” “I saw your hand—I saw the cut and the blood, but then, it was healed, somehow, right, and like, I know I wasn’t supposed to see that and then I felt really bad about it and I wanted to let you know that I know but I didn’t want you to think I was going to, like, blackmail you—” “Blackmail me?” “Of course not,” you quickly say. “Never. No. That’s horrible. Can you imagine what would happen if it got out?” You wince. “Sorry, stupid question, you probably have.”or in which you discover that your neighbor, Jason Todd, is a metahuman, try to compensate, and things get a little... weird.

entry.title: Attention
entry.summary:
Author: LicoricexWitch

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,788Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 132

Summary: You've always been obsessed with superheroes, ever since you were a little kid. You moved to Gotham all alone with stars in your eyes for undergrad before the cold reality of city-living set in. The streets were mean and people weren't as kind as they were back home. It was hard to make friends and you preferred to stay inside, making you even lonelier. You were a regular fish out of water, not a lot of close friends or family, living all alone--the perfect target for someone with not-so-nice intentions. They always said not to meet your heroes because they could never live up to your expectations. Or sometimes, they weren't a hero at all.

entry.title: People Aren't Good
entry.summary:
Author: Miss_nightshade

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,900Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 83

Summary: Hecate has spent her life tucked into the bruised edges of Gotham’s Narrows, pretending to be a small, harmless girl with nothing worth noticing. It’s a fragile lie, but it holds. She goes to school. She walks home alone. She returns to a house that feels older than she is, a place that hums with magic she refuses to touch. She keeps her power buried. She ignores the ancient voices whispering inside her. She does everything she can to stay unseen. And for years, it works. Until the night it doesn’t.

entry.title: It shouldn't bother you...
entry.summary:
Author: Honey_bellie

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,476Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 11

Summary: You have just moved into Gotham a few months ago, you have a new house, a teaching job at a new school, a new sense of normality. Its was true that you had runned away from your old life, but that didn't matter anymore, new begginings. Still you couldn't help but feel something is wrong with this city, shit keeps happening to you and something was telling you wasn't just for the fact you were in the number one "avoid at all costs living here" city. You were definitely getting involved with the wrong people, Red Hood, you should be scared of him, but he keeps showing up at the right time when you need him. Still, you had Jason, right? Although you could feel he was hiding some secrets from you, not that you could blame him because you were doing the same...Authors note: Reader is a really unlucky girl when it comes to be put in dangerous situations as you will notice along that way, but now she has a certain someone watching over her. He falls first and harder. There ought to be some angst along the way, they are two broken people learning how to love and loved. Reader has a mysterious past that will be revealed bit by bit, I'm trying to leave clues so you guys can theorize about it. Its planned to be a long fic.

entry.title: i'd tell you i love you, but then i'd have to kill you
entry.summary:
Author: in_violet_hues

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,390Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 52

Summary: There's a war against Gotham. Guess which side of it you're on? The Arkham Knight's. Under covert circumstances involving Deathstroke, you've been assigned a "special" role, where you operate outside the militia's hierarchy. And it's all thanks to the "unique skills" you possess. That means you have no rank, no restrictions, and an unspoken agreement that would probably turn the entire militia against you. There are just a few problems:- You answer only to the Knight.- You don't like each other (makes the first point difficult).- Also, he's the same guy you hooked up with on your first night in Gotham (makes everything difficult). You're off to a great start. OR: You unknowingly had a one-night stand with your new commander. You try really, really hard not to let it happen again. [No use of Y/N but a codename/nickname will be used]
